CatDescriptText: Mr. Walter Randolph, messenger, of Whitaker was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion, what effect on the community do interracial churches have? Do you believe this type of membership should be encouraged?  Why?"  Answer reads: "I wouldn't know.  It's everybody to his own belief.  Some say it's all right, others say it's wrong."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Walter Randolph, wearing moustache, zippered jacket with collar and zippered breast pocket, and cap, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of flecked stone wall, windows on left and right with light colored curtains, sign in right window inscribed "savings earn..3-1/2 %...current divid..."
